children.name: to reflect light, heat, sound etc
reflect b2
children.definition: reflect/rɪˈflekt/
examples: phản chiếu, phản xạ
▪ the white painted walls reflected the firelight.
những bức tường sơn trắng phản chiếu ánh lửa.
▪ in warm weather, wear light-coloured clothing to reflect the heat.
trong tiết trời ấm áp, mặc quần áo sáng màu để phản xạ nhiệt.
be reflected in something
được phản chiếu trong/trên cái gì đó
▪ from my hotel room, i saw the lights of budapest reflected in the danube.
từ phòng khách sạn của tôi, tôi có thể thấy ánh đèn ở budapest phản chiếu trên sông danube.
▪ picasso’s ‘le miroir’ is a rear-view of a model reflected in a mirror.
‘le miroir’ của picasso là 1 cảnh nhìn phía sau của mẫu hình được phản chiếu trong gương.
reflectverbreturn
[ i or t ] if a surface reflects light, heat, sound, or an image, it sends the light, etc. back and does not absorb it
_he saw himself reflectedinthe water/mirror/shop window.
_the light reflectedoffthe surface of the water.

children.name: molten x
children.definition: molten/ˈməʊltən/  moltenrock, metal, glass etchas been made into a liquid by being heated to a very high temperature:
examples: tan chảy
▪ you can watch craftsmen make beautiful vases out of molten glass.
▪ the town was buried under a river of molten lava.
▪ castings are made by pouring molten metal into a mould and allowing it to solidify.
molten/ˈməʊltən/ [adjective only before noun] molten metal, rock, plastic etc is so hot that it has turned into liquid:
nóng chảy
▪ molten iron is poured into huge moulds and allowed to cool.
▪ rivers of molten rock were flowing down the sides of the volcano.
moltenadjective nấu chảy (kim loại)
describes metal or rock that is in a liquid state because of great heat
_molten glass/lava/lead

children.name: dissolve c2
children.definition: dissolve/dɪˈzɒlvǁdɪˈzɑːlv/  if something solid dissolves or if you dissolve it, it is added to a liquid and mixed with it, so that it become liquid itself:
examples: hòa tan , tan ra
▪ the crystals dissolve in water to create a purple liquid.
▪ dissolve the salt in 125 ml of hot water.
dissolveverbbe absorbed hoà tan; tan ra
[ i or t ](of a solid)to be absorbed by a liquid, especially when mixed, or(of a liquid)to absorb a solid
_dissolve two spoons of powderinwarm water.
_nitric acid will dissolve most animal tissue.

children.name: melt b2
children.definition: melt/melt/  if something solid melts or if heat melts it, it becomes liquid:
examples: tan chảy , làm tan chảy
▪ the chocolate had melted and was all over the inside of her pocket.
▪ melt the butter in a saucepan and stir in the sugar.
melted[adjective only before noun] bị tan chảy
▪ a pasta dish topped with melted cheese
meltverbbecome liquid nấu chảy/tan ra, chảy ra
[ i or t ] to turn from something solid into something soft or liquid, or to cause something to do this
_the snow usually melts by mid march.
_melt the chocolate slowly so that it doesn't burn.
_the meat's beautifully cooked - it meltsin your mouth(= is so pleasantly soft that you do not need to chew it) .

children.name: thaw x
children.definition: thaw/θɔː/  if ice, snow, or a frozen lake or river thaws, it becomes a liquid because the temperature has become warmer:
examples: tan ra
▪ the lake is frozen all winter, but it usually thaws in march.
▪ the snow had started to thaw, and there was a faint scent of spring in the air.

children.name: condense x
children.definition: condense/kənˈdens/  if gas or steam condenses, it becomes liquid by becoming colder:
examples: ngưng tụ, đông đặc
▪ steam from the shower condensed on the cold bathroom mirror.
▪ during cold nights, air condenses on the grass to form dew.
condense into ngưng tụ thành
▪ the gaseous metal is put in a closed container and cooled so that it condenses into liquid zinc.
condenseverbbecome liquid làm ngưng lại (hơi);
[ i or t ] to change or make something change from a gas to a liquid or solid state
_water vapour in the air condenses into fog.

children.name: soluble x
children.definition: soluble/ˈsɒljɑbəlǁˈsɑː-/  a solid substance that is soluble can be mixed into a liquid so that it become part of it:
examples: hoà tan
▪ soluble aspirin
▪ the use of soluble chemical fertilizers is banned, as they seep into rivers and pollute the water supply.
be soluble in something hoàn tan trong cái gì
▪ there are two sorts of vitamins: some are soluble in fat, and some soluble in water.
water-soluble/fat-soluble etc hoà tan trong nước, dầu mỡ
soluble in water, fat etc
▪ plants take up water-soluble minerals through their roots.

children.name: ways of saying that light, heat, sound etc reflects off sth
bounce off x
children.definition: bounce off/ˌbaʊns ˈɒf/  if something such assoundor aradiowavebounces off an object or surface, it reflects off it:
examples: phản xạ lại, bật ra khỏi
▪ her naturally loud voice seemed to bounce off the walls.
giọng nói tự nhiên của cô ấy dường như phản xạ lại những bức tường.
▪ when atmospheric conditions are right, radio waves bounce off the ionosphere and can be received many thousands of miles away.
khi đúng vào những điều kiện khí quyển, sóng radio bật ra khỏi tầng điện li và có thể được thu nhận xa hàng ngàn dặm.

children.name: reflect b2
children.definition: reflect/rɪˈflekt/
examples: phản chiếu, phản xạ
reflect off/from/between etc
phản chiếu, phản xạ trên/từ/giữa...
▪ i was dazzled by the sunlight reflecting off the wet road.
tôi bị lóa mắt bởi ánh sáng mặt trời phản chiếu trên con đường ướt.
▪ the radar signal that reflects back from the airplane is received by the radar dish and is electronically analysed.
tín hiệu ra-đa phản xạ lại từ máy bay được thu nhận bởi đĩa ra-đa và được phân tích bằng thiết bị điện tử.
reflectverbreturn
[ i or t ] if a surface reflects light, heat, sound, or an image, it sends the light, etc. back and does not absorb it
_he saw himself reflectedinthe water/mirror/shop window.
_the light reflectedoffthe surface of the water.

children.name: echo c2
children.definition: echo/ˈekəʊ/  if sound echoes, it is reflected from something such as a wall or mountain so you can hear it repeated as it comes back to you:
examples: vọng lại
▪ the room was vast and empty and every smallest noise we made echoed.
căn phòng trống rộng rãi nên mọi âm thanh nhỏ nhất cũng có thể vang vọng.
echo off/through/throughout etc
vọng xa/qua/khắp...
▪ the thunder of the guns echoed throughout the valley.
tiếng súng vang như sấm khắp thung lũng.

children.name: reflection b2
children.definition: reflection/rɪˈflekʃən/
examples: sự phản chiếu
▪ anna stood looking at her reflection in the mirror.
anna đứng nhìn vào hình phản chiếu của cô trong gương.
reflection of
sự phản chiếu của
▪ a reflection of the moon on the surface of the lake
sự phản chiếu của mặt trăng lên mặt hồ.
reflectionnounreturn
[ c or u ] the image of something in a mirror or on any reflective surface
_in greek mythology, narcissus fell in love with his own reflectionina pool of water.
_he put silver foil around the fire to increase heat reflection.

children.name: to add water to another liquid
dilute x
children.definition: dilute to add a liquid, especially water, to another liquid in order to make it weaker or thinner:pha loãng
examples: pour a little of the antiseptic into a bowl and dilute it before bathing the cut.
dilute with
to make citron pressé, dilute fresh lemon juice with water and add sugar.
continue diluting the tomato sauce with red wine, according to taste.
diluted[adj]bị pha loãng
try giving the baby diluted fruit juice fruit juice diluted with water
once or twice a day.

children.name: water down x
children.definition: water down to add water to another liquid, in order to make it weaker or to increase the amount - use this especially to showdisapproval: pha nước, pha thêm nước
examples: water sth down/ water down sth
you’ll find the paint drips everywhere if you water it down too much.
it’s a very good whisky. much too good to water down.
i’m sure they water down the tomato ketchup at school.
watered-down[adj]
they served us some disgusting watered-down wine.

children.name: reflective x
children.definition: reflective/rɪˈflektɪv/  especially made to reflect light or heat:
examples: ▪ it’s important to wear special reflective clothing when riding a bike.
quan trọng là mặc quần áo phản chiếu đặc biệt khi lái xe đạp.
▪ survival bags are made of reflective material to prevent heat loss.
túi sinh tồn được làm bằng vật liệu phản chiếu để tránh mất mất nhiệt.
highly reflective
phản chiếu cao
▪ the alloy, when polished, is highly reflective.
hợp kim phản chiếu cực cao khi được đánh bóng.

children.name: boil a2
children.definition: boilverbheat liquid đun sôi,/sôi
examples: [ i or t ] to reach, or cause something to reach, the temperature at which a liquid starts to turn into a gas
_liquid nitrogen boils at a very low temperature.
_she scalded herself on some boilingwater.
_if you give water to a small babyto drink, you have to boil it first.

children.name: absorb b2
children.definition: absorbverbtake in hút;hấp thụ
examples: to take something in, especially gradually
_plants absorb carbon dioxide.
_in cold climates, houses need to have walls that will absorb heat.
_towels absorb moisture.
_the drug is quickly absorbedintothe bloodstream.
_our countryside is increasingly being absorbedby/intothe large cities.

children.name: precipitate x
children.definition: precipitateverbchemistry kết tủa; làm cho kết tủa, làm cho lắng
examples: [ i or t ]specializedif a liquid precipitates, substances in it become solid and separate from the liquid
_cooling the beaker helps precipitate the compound.
_if any organic salt is formed, it will precipitate(out)immediately.
precipitatenoun[ c or u ]specialized chất kết tủa, chất lắng
a solid substancewhich is produced from a liquid during a chemical process
_after filtration, the precipitate was dried at 90°c.
precipitationnoun[ u ]chemistry sự kết tủa, sự lắng
specializedwhen a solid substance is produced from a liquid during a chemical process
_the compound is finally obtained by precipitation.

children.name: rust x
children.definition: rust/rʌst/  if something made of iron rusts, it decays by becoming brown and rough, losing its strength, especially because it has not been protected from the damaging effects of water:
examples: gỉ sét
▪ several of the pipes have rusted and will need to be replaced.
một số đường ống bị gỉ sét và cần phải được thay thế.
rust away rust until something begins to break into pieces bị rỉ tới độ vỡ ra
▪ parts of the floor of the car had simply rusted away.
các bộ phận của sàn xe đã bị gỉ tới độ vỡ ra.
rusting[adjective only before noun]gỉ sét
▪ the barn was full of rusting old farm machinery.
chuồng trại đầy rẫy máy móc nông trại cũ gỉ sét
rustverb[ i or t ] làm cho bị gỉ; làm cho bịsét/ bịgỉ; bịsét
to become or cause something to become covered with rust
_older cars will begin to rust.
_years of being left out in the rain had rusted the metal chairs.
_the floor of the car had rustedaway/through(= been destroyed by rust) , so i was careful where i put my feet.
rustnoun[ u ] gỉ (sắt, kim loại)
a reddish brown substance that forms on the surface of iron and steel as a result of decay caused by reacting with air and water_patches of rust

children.name: oxidize x
children.definition: oxidize,uk usuallyoxidiseverb ô-xi hoá/bị ô-xi hoá
examples: if a substance oxidizes, it combines with oxygen and loseshydrogento form another substance, and if something oxidizes a substance, it causes it to do this.
_iron oxidizes to form rust.
_when you heat fat, it oxidizes easily.
oxidize,uk usuallyoxidiseverb[ i or t ] gỉ sét/làm gỉ sét
if a chemical element oxidizes, it loseselectrons(= very small pieces of matterwith negative electrical charge) and if you oxidize it, you cause it to do this.
oxidization,uk usuallyoxidisation sự ô-xi hoá
noun[ u ] (us usuallyoxidation)

children.name: ferment x
children.definition: fermentverb lên men;dậy men/làm lên men;làm dậy men
examples: to (cause something to) change chemically through the action of living substances, such as yeast or bacteria
_you make wine by leaving grape juice to ferment until all the sugar has turned to alcohol.
fermentationnoun[ u ] sự lên men; quátrìnhlên men

children.name: degrade x
children.definition: degradeverbchange structure phân huỷ
examples: [ i ]specialized(of a substance) to change into a more simple chemical structure
_these chemicals quickly degradeintoharmless compounds.

children.name: crystallize x
children.definition: crystallize,uk usuallycrystalliseverbspecialized kết tinh
examples: [ i ] if a liquid crystallizes, it turns intocrystals.
crystallization,uk usuallycrystallisationnoun[ u ] sự kết tinh

children.name: coagulate x
children.definition: coagulateverb làm đông lại; đông lại
examples: to change from liquid to a more solid state, or to cause something to do this
_the sauce coagulated as it cooled down.
_the venom of this snake coagulates the blood.

children.name: reaction x
children.definition: reactionnounsciencephản ứng
examples: [ c or u ] when two or more substances react with and change each other
_achemicalreaction
chemical reactionnoun[ c ] phản ứnghóa học
a process in which the atomic ormolecularstructure of a substance is changed

children.name: corrode x
children.definition: corrode/kəˈrəʊd/  if metal corrodes, it decays by becoming weak and changing its colour, especially because it has not been protected from the damaging effects of chemicals: bị ăn mòn
examples: by the time they found the wreckage of the plane, it had already started to corrode.
corroding[attri] bị ăn mòn
corroding radiators are a problem because they may start to leak.
corroded[adj] metal that is corroded has become weak and has changed colour, especially because it has not been protected from the damaging effects of chemicals, water, and air: bị ăn mòn
you should never use leaking or corroded batteries.
badly corroded metal gutters and downpipes should be replaced by the plastic type.

children.name: corrode x
children.definition: corrode if a chemical corrodes sth metal, it damages it and makes it gradually disappear or become weaker: ăn mòn
examples: salt corrodes metal.
if the batteries leak, they can corrode the case of your flashlight.
the pipework was badly corroded in places.
corrosion[u] the gradual destruction of metal by the effect of water, chemicals etc or a substance such as rust produced by this process :
the problem is how to protect the metal surface from corrosion.
they are sprayed with oil to prevent corrosion.
check for signs of corrosion.
the crash happened as a result of corrosion to the airplane’s fuselage.
corrosive[adj]
a bottle of corrosive acid
that chemical is highly corrosive, so be careful.

children.name: rust x
children.definition: rust if sth made of iron rusts, it is gradually damaged by a chemical reaction with water and turns red-brown in colour: gỉ sét
examples: the iron crosses that marked the graves had rusted badly over the years.
rust away
the underside of the car had virtually rusted away.
rust[u]
